item.title: My Linux Setup for Programming
item.description: This is an epic tutorial on how to setup Linux for the first semester of university, so you don't have to spend an ungodly amount of time figuring out how to get things into a working state. If you want the entire init.vim as well as an ugly script …
item.dc:creator: Werner Drasche

item.title: Continous Background during Dual Boot
item.description:
General

Before you start it has to be mentioned that for this tutorial to provide value in some way you need to have your dual boot setup with refind as the boot selector and plymouth as the splash screen displayer. I will also assume the use of the gnome display …
item.dc:creator: Werner Drasche

item.title: Tic-Tac-Toe using Phoenix Live View
item.description:
Create Epic Gamer Moments with Phoenix

Setup

Have you ever wanted to program Tic-Tac-Toe, the most intimidating coding challenge known to mankind, as a website but without using the horrid fiend that is JavaScript? This guide will give you the enlightenment you seek.

First we create a new phoenix project …
item.dc:creator: Werner Drasche
